help:
~1~dUser commands:
  ~r~g/help | Shows this menu.
  /online | Shows a list with online users and their channels.
  /channels | Shows a list with the available channels.
  /join <channel> [password] | Changes channel.
  /msg <user> | Sends a private message across different channels.
  /r <msg> | Responds to the last private message.
  /block <username> | Blocks all messages from that username.
  /unblock <username> | Unblocks the username.
  /clear | Clears the chat window of the client.
  /sudo | Grants permission to execute admin commands.
  /exit | Terminates the connection with the client.
~1~dAdmin commands:
  ~r~g/info <username> | Shows information about the connection.
  /ban <username> | Adds the username to forbidden usernames and kicks the client.
  /unban <username> | Removes the username from forbidden usernames.
  /ipban <ip> | Adds the ip to forbidden ips and kicks the client.
  /ipunban <ip> | Removes the ip from forbidden ips.
  /kick <username> | Terminates the connection of the client.
  /mute <username> | Prevents the client from writing to anyone.
  /unmute <username> | Unmutes the client.
  /broadcast <msg> [channel] | Sends a message to all channels or to a specific one.
  /tell <msg> <username> | Sends a message to a client.

  *You can execute admin commands from the client only by prefixing them with /sudo.
  Example: /sudo /ban user12
missing-argument: Missing argument, please check the list with commands and try again.
already-in: You are already in this channel.
already-blocked: You have already blocked this user.
already-unblocked: You have already unblocked this user.
cant-msg: You can't send a message to yourself.
cant-send: You can't send messages to that user anymore. :(
banned: You have been banned from the server.
kicked: You have been kicked from the server.
cl-user-info:
User info (%s):
  - IP: %s
  - Channel: %s
  - Blocked (%d): %s
  - Muted: %s
cl-missing-argument: Missing argument, please check the list with commands and try again.
cl-invalid-argument: Invalid argument, please check the list with commands and try again.
cl-help:
Commands:
  /help | Shows this menu.
  /online | Shows a list with online users and their channels.
  /channels | Shows a list with the available channels.
  /clear | Clears the console.
  /info <username> | Shows information about the connection.
  /ban <username> | Adds the username to forbidden usernames and kicks the client.
  /unban <username> | Removes the username from forbidden usernames.
  /ipban <ip> | Adds the ip to forbidden ips and kicks the client.
  /ipunban <ip> | Removes the ip from forbidden ips.
  /kick <username> | Terminates the connection of the client.
  /mute <username> | Prevents the client from writing to anyone.
  /unmute <username> | Unmutes the client.
  /broadcast <msg> [channel] | Sends a message to all channels or to a specific one.
  /tell <msg> <username> | Sends a message to a client.
  /mode <default/traffic/debug/commands-only> | Changes the console mode.
  /stop | Stops the server.
